posts.post_content:
it's a pity that this part of the kaldra set is that overprized.  
i mean, this combo isn't that powerful anyways, therefore it could either have been up to three mana cheeper concerning playing and equipment cost,  
they could have added "Equipped creature is indestructible and can block an additional creature",  
or they could have given the equipment and/or the creature "super-shroud" (the permanent can't be targets of spells or abilities your opponens control) on top of indestructibility.
posts.html:
it's a pity that this part of the kaldra set is that overprized.
i mean, this combo isn't that powerful anyways, therefore it could either have been up to three mana cheeper concerning playing and equipment cost,
they could have added "Equipped creature is indestructible and can block an additional creature",
or they could have given the equipment and/or the creature "super-shroud" (the permanent can't be targets of spells or abilities your opponens control) on top of indestructibility.

[Indestructibility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indestructibility) can be destroyed easily. It also can't be moved to multiple creatures whenever you want. It's also colored, which requires you to have that color in a deck.

posts.post_content:
This brings me to a question: Is there such a thing as untargeted exiling from the battlefield?  
  
Edit: Thanks, that is exactly what I was looking for.  
  
And for your other needs, there's always [Kederekt Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kederekt Leviathan), which puts everything back in the hand where it can be discarded, perhaps into a [Leyline of the Void](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of the Void).

Posted By: TheWallinator74 (6/23/2012 9:10:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Drfaustmd  
  
Final Judgment would be useless here. You'd be exiling a token, not the equipment. Because you still control the equipment then, you could just remake the creature. If you want to get rid of this, play [Into the Core](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Core) and target [Shield of Kaldra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shield of Kaldra) and [Helm of Kaldra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helm of Kaldra). Your opponent will be left with a 9/9 token creature that is no longer indestructible.
posts.html:
@Drfaustmd

Final Judgment would be useless here. You'd be exiling a token, not the equipment. Because you still control the equipment then, you could just remake the creature. If you want to get rid of this, play Into the Core and target Shield of Kaldra and Helm of Kaldra. Your opponent will be left with a 9/9 token creature that is no longer indestructible.
